Omicron is a variant of the virus that causes #COVID19. To protect yourself and others:

üíâ Get vaccinated as soon as it's your turn
üò∑ #WearAMask
‚ÜîÔ∏è Keep physical distance and avoid crowds
ü™ü Open windows
üí™ Cough/sneeze into your elbow
üëê Clean your hands

#DYK?: Recirculating indoor air can increase the spread of the virus that causes #COVID19.

Good ventilation protects you from infection. Bring fresh, outdoor air inside and let indoor air outside when using fans, air conditioners and filters ‚¨áÔ∏è

If a child in your life is worried that #SantaClaus üéÖ might not be able to travel and deliver presents üéÅ due to #COVID19, Dr @mvankerkhove can provide reassurance: Santa Claus is immune. https://t.co/X9LpUneMvZ

The diagnostic accuracy of routinely used PCR & antigen-based rapid diagnostic test assays does not appear to be impacted by Omicron.

üëâhttps://t.co/2qN4jHHrnF¬†#COVID19 https://t.co/Vbh5byKh0N

There are still limited available data, and no peer-reviewed evidence, on vaccine efficacy or effectiveness for Omicron. 

üëâhttps://t.co/2qN4jHHrnF¬†#COVID19 https://t.co/Vbh5byKh0N

Early observation data from South Africa, the United Kingdom & Denmark suggest a reduced risk of hospitalization for Omicron compared to Delta. 

üëâhttps://t.co/2qN4jHHrnF¬†#COVID19 https://t.co/Vbh5byKh0N

There is consistent evidence that Omicron has a substantial growth advantage over Delta.
It is spreading significantly faster in countries with documented community transmission, with a doubling time of 2-3 days. 

üëâhttps://t.co/2qN4jHHrnF¬†#COVID19 https://t.co/Vbh5byKh0N

As of 23 December 2021, the ##COVID19 Omicron variant had been identified in 110 countries.

In several countries where there is evidence of widespread local transmission, the Omicron variant has become dominant.

3‚É£ People may also become infected with #COVID19 when touching their eyes, nose or mouth after touching surfaces or objects that have been contaminated by the virus https://t.co/hw2hnFTErv https://t.co/R0P2JEOg8x
2‚É£ #COVID19 can also spread indoors where it's poorly ventilated and/or crowded and people tend to spend longer periods of time https://t.co/hw2hnFTErv https://t.co/R0P2JEOg8x
#COVID19 can spread from an infected person‚Äôs mouth or nose in small liquid particles when they cough, sneeze, speak, sing or breathe https://t.co/hw2hnFTErv https://t.co/R0P2JEOg8x

We know that #COVID19 spreads between people in several different ways.

1‚É£ Current evidence suggests that the virus spreads mainly between people who are in close contact with each other, for example at a conversational distance https://t.co/hw2hnFTErv https://t.co/F10ILQKm5I
Vaccines can offer protection but it is also essential to¬†#WearAMask and avoid large crowds to keep¬†#COVID19 away during the holiday season https://t.co/A66AF6Y7WF https://t.co/kXOxajjZsn

Good ventilation protects you from #COVID19 infection:

‚úÖ Open window
‚úÖ Create a cross breeze
‚úÖ Place a fan in front of a window facing the outside
‚úÖ If it's very hot or cold, open windows for a few minutes every hour

A respirator (FFP2, FFP3, NIOSH-approved N95, or equivalent or higher-level certified respirator) or a medical mask should be worn by health workers along with a gown, gloves & eye protection ‚Äì before entering a room where there is a patient with suspected or confirmed #COVID19. https://t.co/F10PziWaAT

Policies should be developed, strengthened & implemented to encourage appropriate adherence to preventive measures to reduce #COVID19 transmission - #WearAMask, physical distance, ventilation, clean hands frequently, cover mouth & nose when coughing/sneezing, get vaccinated. https://t.co/I20kKU7vOp

People with a higher risk of severe complications from #COVID19 (over 60 years old or with underlying diseases, e.g. cardiovascular disease, diabetes, cancer, obesity, asthma) should wear a well-fitted medical mask where physical distancing of at least 1 metre is not possible. https://t.co/I20kKU7vOp

The vast majority of current infections and #COVID19 cases are observed in unvaccinated people. If breakthroughs occur in vaccinated persons, in most cases events are less severe than those in unvaccinated persons üëâhttps://t.co/Aw3c9kUpFl
In the context of ongoing global #COVID19 vaccine supply constraints & inequities, broad-based administration of booster doses risks exacerbating vaccine access. üëâhttps://t.co/Aw3c9kUpFl
The focus of #COVID19 immunization efforts must remain on decreasing death and severe disease, and the protection of the health care system. üëâhttps://t.co/Aw3c9kUpFl
UPDATED: WHO & the Strategic Advisory Group of Experts (SAGE) interim statement on booster doses for #COVID19 vaccination üëâhttps://t.co/Aw3c9kUpFl https://t.co/Y1AjLPJHRZ

Full speech of @DrTedros' opening remarks at the media briefing on #COVID19 - 22.12.2021
https://t.co/Jt3hddAWKg

"2022 must be the end of the #COVID19 pandemic.
But it must also be the beginning of something else ‚Äì a new era of solidarity."-@DrTedros

"The [#COVID19] vaccines in the trial were selected by an independent advisory group of leading scientists and experts."-@DrTedros
https://t.co/wrX3pCcKOH

"It is also intended to uncover second-generation [#COVID19] vaccines with greater protection against variants of concern, with longer duration of protection, or to assess vaccines that can be given without needles."-@DrTedros
https://t.co/wrX3pCcKOH

"The Solidarity Trial Vaccines is co-sponsored by WHO and the Ministries of Health of Colombia, Mali and Philippines, and aims to accelerate the evaluation of more #COVID19 vaccines, to expand the portfolio and improve access."-@DrTedros https://t.co/BchNKCZIeo
"Even as we work to make the best use of the [#COVID19] vaccines we have, WHO is also working to identify the next generation of vaccines through the Solidarity Trial Vaccines."-@DrTedros

"No country can boost its way out of the [#COVID19] pandemic.
And boosters cannot be seen as a ticket to go ahead with planned celebrations, without the need for other precautions."-@DrTedros

"It‚Äôs important to remember that the vast majority of hospitalizations & deaths are in unvaccinated people, not un-boosted people.
And we must be very clear that the [#COVID19] vaccines we have remain effective against both the Delta & Omicron variants."-@DrTedros

"Blanket booster programmes are likely to prolong the [#COVID19] pandemic, rather than ending it, by diverting supply to countries that already have high levels of vaccination coverage, giving the virus more opportunity to spread and mutate."-@DrTedros
https://t.co/yAvqGbUIC6

"Today, the WHO Strategic Advisory Group of Experts on Immunization, or SAGE, is issuing an interim statement on [#COVID19 vaccine] booster doses."-@DrTedros

‚ñ∂Ô∏è https://t.co/kUt44eb3Mv

"However, only later in 2022 will supply be sufficient for extensive use of [#COVID19 vaccine] boosters in all adults."-@DrTedros
https://t.co/d2sAX6k9QJ

"Enough [#COVID19] vaccines were administered globally this year that the 40% target could have been reached in every country by September, if those vaccines had been distributed equitably, through #COVAX and AVAT."-@DrTedros

"Today, WHO is issuing updated guidance for health workers, recommending the use of either a respirator or a medical mask, in addition to other personal protective equipment, when entering a room where there is a patient with suspected or confirmed #COVID19."-@DrTedros
"As Omicron becomes the dominant [#COVID19] variant in many countries, all of us need to take extra precautions."-@DrTedros https://t.co/gDCrn7O38q

"And still, COVID-19 continues to claim around 50 thousand lives every week."-@DrTedros
https://t.co/SN1ppld2HE
Media briefing on #COVID19 with @DrTedros https://t.co/UpfviKG6c4

How does #COVID19 spread? What are some modes of transmission? What can you do to protect yourself?
@DrMikeRyan explains. https://t.co/y2NLTvBtj1

#COVAX delivered over 750 million #COVID19 vaccine doses globally, despite challenges like vaccine hoarding & insufficient transparency from manufacturers https://t.co/QYt8jV9WWh https://t.co/CBSET7YvVb

The @ACTAccelerator halved the cost of #COVID19 rapid tests for low & lower-middle income countries; procured over 148 million tests.
https://t.co/TFes6wb0vW

1‚É£ Innovation and inequities in the #COVID19 response

WHO has validated 10 vaccines as safe, effective & high-quality; Over 8 billion vaccine doses have been administered worldwide but by the end of November, only 1 in 4 African health workers were fully vaccinated. https://t.co/1JJfHnPWYh

üôèüèΩ "I thank you, our friends in the media, for the role you play in covering WHO, helping to get our messages out, and in holding us accountable.
We very much appreciate those of you who have worked to cover WHO and the pandemic fairly & accurately."-@DrTedros
üôèüèΩ "I thank the scientists, researchers and public health experts who continue to develop new tools against this virus [causing #COVID19], and to study it."-@DrTedros

"In the year ahead, WHO is committed to doing everything in our power to end the [#COVID19] pandemic, and to beginning a new era in global health ‚Äì an era in which health is at the centre of every country‚Äôs development plans."-@DrTedros

"Even before the pandemic, one billion people were spending more than 10% of their household budget on health care. 
When people can‚Äôt access the services they need, or can‚Äôt afford them, individuals, families, communities and entire societies are put at risk."-@DrTedros

"2022 must be the year we end the [#COVID19] pandemic."-@DrTedros
